definition: lightning/electricity/electric (bound form)/to get (or give) an electric shock/phone call or telegram etc/to send via telephone or telegram etc

sentences.english: Ge You is an old stager in Chinese film industry.
sentences.chinese: 葛優是中國電影界的老戲骨。

sentences.english: Jiang Wen is at the top of the world - the world of Chinese cinema, that is.
sentences.chinese: 姜文登上了中國電影界的巔峯。

sentences.english: At the top of the country's film industry, the mood is both bullish and ebullient.
sentences.chinese: 匈牙利電影界的上層，充滿了昂揚和熱情洋溢的氣氛。

sentences.english: The young man could be called the Apollo of our filmdom.
sentences.chinese: 這個青年大可以稱爲我們電影界中的白馬王子。

sentences.english: Actor-director Jiang Wen is a pillar of the Chinese film industry.
sentences.chinese: 演員兼導演姜文是中國電影界的棟樑。

sentences.english: Hemmings is enjoying a newfound popularity as a character actor in the movies.
sentences.chinese: 作爲電影界的一名性格演員，亨明斯最近開始走紅。

sentences.english: Mr. Oliver worked for 30 years in the movies.
sentences.chinese: 奧利佛在電影界任務三十年。

sentences.english: I will signalize you in the filmdom in two years.
sentences.chinese: 我將在兩年內使你在電影界出人頭地。

sentences.english: Leading film and media scholars are frequent participants in Forum events.
sentences.chinese: 許多重要的電影界及傳播界的學者是討論會的常客。

sentences.english: After "Winter Love Song" he advanced to the movie world in Korea.
sentences.chinese: 在《冬季戀歌》之後，他朝著韓國電影界進軍。

sentences.english: Soderbergh played down speculation that he was planning to retire from filmmaking.
sentences.chinese: 索德伯格打消了外界對他準備從電影界退休的猜測。

definition: to reveal outstanding talent (idiom); to stand out as conspicuously brilliant
to recruit talent/to round up/to enlist the services of sb
flourishing and still in the ascendant (idiom); rapidly expanding/still growing strong/on the up
UNESCO, United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization
venturing from one's thatched hut for the first time (idiom)/young and inexperienced/novice/greenhorn
(Tw) to draw on (others' experience)/to learn from (how others do things)/lesson to be learned (by observing others)
creative industries (design, music, publishing etc)/abbr. for 文化創意產業|文化创意产业
extremely rare (idiom)/once in a blue moon
